Dear Ojai Unified Families,

As we close our first week of full Distance Learning, we want to share with you some new student and family services.

Please visit our website at https://www.ojaiusd.org/article/302158 for information on these services, including OUSD Nutrition Services' Meals Program and Family Fund Program, Mental Health Services for Students, as well as Parent Support Groups, our district's new "Technology Tent Fridays" initiative, and more. Thanks to the City of Ojai for opening Cooling Centers this weekend - more information at bit.ly/OjaiCoolC

We want to thank our teachers and staff for their incredible commitment to the work we have before us. We have seen and heard many success stories of students and teachers engaging well in Distance Learning. We are working hard to ensure that we have the best program possible, and will be sending a survey next week so that you can provide feedback to help us grow and learn.

Have a wonderful and safe weekend.

Dr. Tiffany Morse, Superintendent

*Food Benefits for Families!*

Due to Coronavirus (COVID-19), children who are eligible for free or reduced-price meals at school will get extra food benefits. These food benefits are called Pandemic EBT or P-EBT benefits. P-EBT benefits help families in California buy food when schools are closed because of the coronavirus emergency. Families will get up to $365 per eligible child on their P-EBT card to use on food and groceries.

Families with children who are eligible for free or reduced-price meals and have not received their P-EBT card in the mail must apply online before June 30, 2020 at ca.p-ebt.org.

Call 877-328-9677 for more information.

She became a part-time RSP teacher at Chaparral High School for the 2013-2014 school year, and served the needs of the students at Chaparral High School until her passing on May 28, 2020, at home with her family. She was very dedicated to her work in helping her students to succeed.

If you would like to make a contribution in Maurya‚Äôs name, her family has asked that it be a contribution to your favorite charity ‚Äì Maurya herself was always supportive of the Humane Society.

With sorrow,
Tiffany Morse, Superintendent

Since 2002, Food For Thought Ojai has provided garden education at OUSD school sites, working with teachers and students to keep our school gardens thriving and ready for lessons in nutrition, history, geography, math, and science. Acting as #experientialeducation opportunities, these gardens are places to play, relax, taste and experience the joys of gardening.

FFTOjai's on-going program has helped to raise awareness of the importance of healthy nutritional practices, and the integral role of agriculture in our community, encouraging students to reconnect to the land and the environment that sustains them.
Recently, OUSD students collected seeds for a seed bank and harvested lettuce, planted in the fall.

Mira Monte Elementary School Partners with Ojai Studio Artists for new Wall Ball Project!

Last week, Mira Monte Elementary School opened its newest on-campus project - several "Wall Ball" walls!

Wall Ball is a game - similar to hand ball - that our students and parents wanted to add to the many recess and lunchtime activity choices at Mira Monte. Integrating both #wellness and #creativity, this project was funded by Mira Monte Elementary School's PTO, and designed and created by local artist Gayel Childress and Mira Monte's 4th and 5th grade students.

We're thankful for our community of artists who continue to engage with our schools and students on projects like Mira Monte Elementary School's newest "functional" art project!

#EdArt #heartandfutureofOjai

*We Are Family: OUSD Family Fund Delivers Winter Clothing to Students!*

As part of our district's student-centered vision, and values of #wellness and #inclusion, OUSD Family Fund delivered hundreds of warm clothing items during our *Winter Clothing Giveaway Day* on Saturday, December 7th!

We want to thank our wonderful community members, HELP of Ojai, Weil Tennis Academy, and The Thacher School, for the generous donations of hats, shoes, gloves, scarves, jackets, coats, sweaters, pants, sweats/sweatshirts, backpacks, and more! Kara Hooper and Becky Beckett helped to coordinate the event, and Thacher student volunteers also helped with setup!

OUSD Family Fund's mission is to partner with OUSD families in offering assistance in seven identified areas of need. OUSD families interested in learning more may request applications from their students' school site Office Managers.

#Giving #Inclusion
